info.title: Azure Table Storage
info.description: Azure Table storage is a service that stores structured NoSQL data in the cloud, providing a key/attribute store with a schemaless design. Sign into your Storage account to create, update, and query tables and more.

get.description: List all the tables for your storage account.

parameters.name: storageAccountName
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or table endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or table endpoint

parameters.name: x-ms-client-request-id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for tracking the request.

post.description: This operation adds a table to the storage account.

parameters.name: storageAccountName
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or table endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or table endpoint

parameters.name: TableName
parameters.description: Specify the new table

parameters.name: x-ms-client-request-id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for tracking the request.

x-ms-request-id.description: Unique identifier for tracking the request

get.description: This operation queries the entities in a table.

parameters.name: storageAccountName
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or table endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or table endpoint

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: Specify the table.

parameters.name: NextPartitionKey
parameters.description: The next partition key returned for queries and read-feed operations if there are more results to be read.

parameters.name: NextRowKey
parameters.description: The next row key returned for queries and read-feed operations if there are more results to be read.

parameters.name: x-ms-client-request-id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for tracking the request.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: OData filter query for which entities to return. Example: Column eq 'Value' and Column2 ne 2. Invalid OData queries, such as not wrapping string values in quotes will return 501.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData select query for the columns to be returned. Example: Column, PartitionKey

x-ms-request-id.description: Unique identifier for tracking the request

post.description: Operation to add an entity to a table.

parameters.name: storageAccountName
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or table endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or table endpoint

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: Specify the table.

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: Entity to insert into the specified table. This entity must contain entries for a PartitionKey and a RowKey. Example: {"PartitionKey" : "Partition", "RowKey" : "Row", "StringField" : "Value", "IntegerField" : 1}

parameters.name: x-ms-client-request-id
parameters.description: A client supplied identifier for the operation, which will be echoed in the server response.

x-ms-request-id.description: Unique identifier for tracking the request

get.description: This operation gets the entity in a table based on the partition and row key.

parameters.name: storageAccountName
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or table endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or table endpoint

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: Specify the table.

parameters.name: PartitionKey
parameters.description: The partition id containing this entity

parameters.name: RowKey
parameters.description: The row id containing this entity

parameters.name: x-ms-client-request-id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for tracking the request.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: OData select query for the columns to be returned. Example: Column, PartitionKey

x-ms-request-id.description: Unique identifier for tracking the request

put.description: Operation to replace an entity in a table, creating a new entity if needed.

parameters.name: storageAccountName
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or table endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or table endpoint

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: Specify the table.

parameters.name: PartitionKey
parameters.description: The partition id containing this entity

parameters.name: RowKey
parameters.description: The row id containing this entity

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: JSON Entity to insert into the specified table. If you specify Row or Partition Keys in this field, they must match the corresponding field value. Example: {"FieldName" : "Value", "IntegerField" : 1}

parameters.name: x-ms-client-request-id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for tracking the request..

x-ms-request-id.description: Unique identifier for tracking the request
Unique identifier for tracking the request

parameters.description: The partition id containing this entity

parameters.name: entity
parameters.description: JSON Entity to insert or merge into the specified table. If you specify Row or Partition Keys in this field, they must match the corresponding field value. Example: {"FieldName" : "Value", "IntegerField" : 1}

parameters.name: x-ms-client-request-id
parameters.description: A client supplied identifier for the operation, which will be echoed in the server response.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag to match for concurrency. * to match all values.
